message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.NE 

This paper deals with the problem of learning camera sensor designs jointly with networks that carry out inference on the images they capture. This involves the use of deep feed-forward neural networks, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques to optimize the sensor design, which falls under the category of cs.MM (Multimedia). Additionally, the paper proposes a novel approach to jointly optimize the sensor design and the reconstruction network, which involves the use of gradient-based optimization techniques. This falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves the use of information theory to optimize the sensor design, which falls under the category of cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the paper involves the use of neural networks to optimize the sensor design, which falls under the category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
